data.text: @OttawaHealth Pfizer documents are being released, one such document lists 9 pages of side effects, over 1200 of them. Please make sure you give the list to all those being injected. After all, informed consent is a requirement. BTW  neonatal death is one of the side effects.
@OttawaHealth No thanks! Iâ€™ve survived this long without it.
@pinkcaneredlip @OttawaHealth The data proves this is not true whatsoever.
@pinkcaneredlip @OttawaHealth Vaccination does not stop transmission so why have mandates ?
@OttawaHealth Masks...masks are important too. Simple and cost effective. Masks. https://t.co/zkM8kIhCZN

@MeLauraC @OttawaHealth And @OttawaHealth should be promoting BOTH. Get vaccinated. Wear N95s. Especially as young kids can't get vaccinated. Also should be encouraging businesses to install air filtration. Not this tacit approval of removal of masks.

@MeLauraC @OttawaHealth So n95s are the best defence against catching covid. Vaccinations are the best defence against serious consequences and long covid should you happen to catch it. Thus both should be mandatory.

@MeLauraC @OttawaHealth It helps, sure, but with omicron and waning immunity (3 months since we started getting boosters) it's more about lessening covid's effects than prevention. So you won't likely end up in the hospital but you'll still get sick. N95s are all about prevention. Having both is key.
@mariellequinton @OttawaHealth The vaccination is your best defence. N95 are essential too but vaccination (3 doses) is key.
